action.action-desc: Mr. Mills (for himself, Mr. Webster of Florida, Mr. Steube, Mr. Baird, Mr. Buchanan, Mr. DesJarlais, and Mr. Perry) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To prohibit certain business concerns from receiving assistance from the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preventing SBA Assistance from Going to China Act.

section.header: Prohibition on small business concern affiliation with the People’s Republic of China
section.text: Section 3(a) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on affiliation with the people’s republic of china
paragraph.text: For purposes of this Act, a concern may not be considered a small business concern if such concern is—

subparagraph.text: located and incorporated in the People’s Republic of China; or
has more than 25 percent of the voting stock of the concern owned by affiliates that are citizens of or organized under the laws of the People’s Republic of China.
